© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
Fill rate analysis
1
• Consolidated various data sources – JD Edwards, SharePoint into a data model 
using ADF pipelines and analyzed Orders and Fulfilment data
• Developed a Power BI dashboard  to support the Supply Chain team in 
analyzing the performance of warehouses in fulfilling the orders, by focusing on 
key Fill rate metrics
Nutritional health products manufacturer

© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
Accordion Value Add 
•
Defined the logic for calculating fill rate at order, line, unit, value($) level using ‘First Shipment Date’ (minimum shipment date at which units were shipped 
among all the lines for an order)
•
Built the required pipelines on Azure Data factory & structured data models on Visual Studio 
•
Developed a self serve robust Power BI dashboard focusing on weekly, quarterly and monthly comparison of different fill rate metrics at Brand, Channel and 
Business Unit levels to identify any concerning trends where action might be needed 
•
Performed YoY comparison of shipment and fill rate data to provide insights into the trends and variances 
•
Analyzed customer and supplier level data for different fill rates to identify the top customers that were getting impacted because of nonperformance
Situation
•
Client lacked visibility to analyze the performance of warehouses in fulfilling the orders on an ongoing basis due to absence of standard reporting and lack 
of agreed definitions for calculating different fill rate metrics
•
Partnered with the client to evaluate the key drivers that impact fill rate, finalize the definitions of various fill rate metrics, and build Power BI dashboard 
that is refreshed daily to track these metrics
Fill rate analysis for nutritional health products manufacturer
2
Impact
•
The Customer & Item level drill-throughs provided across the report enabled client to easily filter down to individual customer level details to take specific 
actions based on the fill rate performance for the selected time period
•
The automated dashboard was leveraged as the final source of reporting for the fill rate metric ensuring that the entire Supply Chain team is looking at same 
data and metrics
•
The report helped the warehousing team in managing their third-party logistics as they can easily pull the shipments by Warehouse
FILL RATE ANALYSIS

© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
Approach & Methodology
3
APPROACH
# TOTAL
SUB-TOPIC 02
FILL RATE
▪Calculated total # orders, # lines and # units based on first shipment date of an 
order
▪First shipment date refers to the minimum shipment date at which units were 
shipped to the customers among all the lines in an order
▪As the requested date keeps changing with time, this helped client in identifying 
the total # orders, # lines and # units for the selected time period
▪An order is considered shipped if all the lines got shipped together 
at first shipment date
▪Shipped Line – # lines that got shipped together on first shipment 
date for an order
▪Shipped Units – # units in all the lines that got shipped together on 
first shipment date for an order
▪$ Shipped Value – Sum of the invoice amount for all the lines that 
got shipped on first shipment date for an order 
▪Order Fill Rate – Ratio of # Shipped Orders and # Total Orders 
▪Line Fill Rate – Ratio of # Shipped Lines and # Total Lines
▪Unit Fill Rate – Ratio of # Shipped Units and # Total Units
▪$ Value Fill Rate – Ratio of $ Shipped Value and $ Total Value
# SHIPPED
Note: Total Lines (or Units) contains the lines (or units) that got shipped after the first shipment date for an order in addition to the lines/units that got shipped on first 
shipment date

© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
